Best purchase I've ever made on steam possibly. I love this game, but I think I have an advantage when playing because I've got a close group of really awesome friends in a ventrilo server that all play the game at the same time so I have a reliable team to fall back on if the public servers suck.

If you have a group of good friends to play with this is a really fun game, but if all you have is public servers I don't think you'll have as much fun because people are assholes.

An awesome game to play now and then,especially with a decent team. Most of the randoms are not really coop-players though,which is one of the main problems since the game is called CO-OP Surivival Horror for a reason. Without a balanced team of decent players you wont be able to finish any map on normal,hard,suicidal or even hell on earth (normal is already quite hard). The perk system is alright,though it takes some time to get commando and berserker up,commando (the perk for assault rifles) is pure grinding of one ("rare") mob-type from lvl 3 on. 

The only real problem is the team-issue with most of the randoms not being able to work together properly which is required to win. One minor issue is that it gets sort of repetetive after playing for a while,it's basically always the same procedure: xxx mobs spawn,you kill them (or die^^), you all run to the trader,repeat for xx rounds.
Get this game when it goes on sale again! Fun game!

Es de los mejores shooters cooperativos junto con los L4D; puedes elegir entre varias clases como por ejemplo médico, comando, francotirador... que puedes ir mejorando para conseguir ventajas en las armas asociadas a ellas, como más velocidad de recarga y esas cosas.

Ah Killing Floor. This has come a long way since it's days as a mod for Unreal Tournament. This game has got a massive online community, and with good reason. Don't let the menus fool you, the graphics are brilliant. Picking one of the six classes reflects your personal playstyle, with a lot of character skins to use, such as the Pyro from TF2! The maps are brilliant, well built and have great camping positions to hold off the hoards of enemies. There is also a wide variety of weapons, such as your average pistols, to fully automatic shotguns, to fireball launchers! To round off, great weapons, great maps, strange enemies, character customisation, an all round great game.
Ps, don't jump out of the top window on offices. You'll regret it.

Straight, no nonsense zombie survival game. Single player is impossible and not so fun, and the levelling system means that when you first play, its harder for you than others who have played for a while, but if you can get a group of your friends together and play a match together, it is very fun and addictive.
Not really worth paying for compared to some free mods that are out there.
Definitely worth your money!

The best first person team shooter ever, by far. England does it right. Class bassed teamwork, with a focus on accuracy over bullet quantity, and the required use of iron sights makes this game a lovely refresher form the ridiculous "pump full of lead till they drop" american shooters.

Killing zombies is fun.  Getting a game for just a few dollars (if it's on sale) is fun too.  The levelling and perk system in this game sets it above Team Fortress 2, as does the fact that it is cooperative, not competitive, which I like quite a bit more.

This is a fun game even if it falls short compared to Left 4 Dead. There are quite a few bugs in this game. It seems a bit unpolished maybe, and not very impressive visually or sound-wise, but the gameplay is very good. At increasing difficulties it's quite a challenge and you will have to think about strategies. Humor and atmosphere is good. Plenty of perks to chose from and level up. Lots of weapons with pros and cons. Tons of achievements. Many DLCs available that unlock characters and weapons. Regular events keeps it interesting, introducing new maps and themes.

Give it a shot. Especially if it's on sale.

rustled my jims

I'm sorry to say it, but Killing Floor's chainsaw just does not compare to Left 4 Dead's. Their chainsaw is a thing of beauty, it's destruction is so complete, so visceral that I feel myself becoming one with the saw in our mutual quest for bloodshed. It's a unique kind of nirvana were all the little annoyances of the world melt away, leaving only the most pure, unbridled tearing of flesh and crunching of bone.

Killing Floor lacks that. It's chainsaw isn't an unstoppable whirlwind of gore, it's just another weapon, abstract numbers with no real meaning. There's something primordial in L4D's saw, something raw and untamed that taps into the primal recesses of our ancient memories as hunter-gatherers. When chopping monsters to pieces, a warrior must feel like his own teeth are sinking into to bleeding viscera of his foes.

Again, Killing Floor doesn't have that, but what it does have is a flamethrower and some manner of asbestos heat-ray so it's a good compensation.
For a game that cost 20 bucks you can't go wrong with Killing Floor.
